member.name: T:Zyan.Communication.ChannelSinks.Compression.ICompressible
member.summary: The ICompressible interface implements a property that returns a flag, which determines if the request or response should be compressed. This interface is used in conjuction with the compression sink implementation and allows to determine dynamically if the request or response is to be compressed.
member.remarks: The following is the order, in which the criteria are evaluated to determine if the request or response is to be compressed: Threshold should be greater than zero. NonCompressible marks the object as an exempt. If object size is greater than threshold and not marked as NonCompressible, the ICompressible is evaluated.

member.name: P:Zyan.Communication.ChannelSinks.Compression.ICompressible.PerformCompression
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the data can be compressed.
member.value: true if the data should be compressed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Zyan.Communication.Delegates.SafeDynamicInvoker
member.summary: A safer replacement for the Delegate.DynamicInvoke method.

member.name: M:Zyan.Communication.Delegates.SafeDynamicInvoker.GetDynamicInvoker(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Gets the dynamic invoker for the given delegate.
member.remarks: Dynamic invokers uses runtime code generation instead of the late binding of the Delegate.DynamicInvoke. It doesn't wrap the exception thrown by the delegate into . On .NET runtime (versions 3.5, 4.0 and 4.5), this invoker is 10-12 times faster than the original DynamicInvoke. On Mono runtime (version 2.10.5), it performs 1.5-2 times slower than the original DynamicInvoke.

member.name: M:Zyan.Communication.Delegates.SafeDynamicInvoker.SafeDynamicInvoke(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Dynamically invokes the method represented by the given delegate. The delegate can be null.
member.remarks: Ensures that all delegates of the invocation list are called (even if some exceptions occured). If several delegates throw exceptions, then the first exception is rethrown. In .NET 4.0, all exceptions are aggregated into one AggregateException.
member.returns: The return value of the delegate

member.name: M:Zyan.Communication.Delegates.SafeDynamicInvoker.OneWayDynamicInvoke(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Dynamically invokes the method represented by the given delegate as a one-way method. The delegate can be null.

member.name: P:Zyan.Communication.Delegates.SafeDynamicInvoker.ThreadPool
member.summary: Gets or sets the thread pool used to send server events to remote subscribers.
member.remarks: Assign this property to an instance of the class to fall back to the standard .

member.name: T:Zyan.Communication.Protocols.Tcp.DuplexChannel.TcpExChannel
member.summary: A replacement for the standard Tcp remoting channel that allows communication in both directions over a single tcp connection.
member.remarks:
TcpExChannel only supports IPv4. Remoting Configuration Parameters:
portThe tcp port the channel should listen on. If this is specified, the channel will automatically start listening on that port.
listenIndicates the channel should start listening. This is not required if the port parameter is specified. If no port is specified the channel will choose a random unused port.
bufferSizeThe size of the buffer to use when sending data over a connection.
priorityThe priority of the channel.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TCP KeepAlive time in milliseconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TCP KeepAlive interval in milliseconds

member.name: M:Zyan.Communication.Protocols.Tcp.DuplexChannel.TcpExChannel.CreateMessageSink(System.String,System.Object,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns a channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object.
member.param: The URL to which the new sink will deliver messages. Can be null.
The channel data object of the remote host to which the new sink will deliver messages. Can be null.
When this method returns, contains a URI of the new channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: A channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object, or null if the channel cannot connect to the given endpoint.
member.exception: The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
